posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
I think you're not exactly right on your stats there, mate. I don't know how you can reach 102 AC with this build on a +5 environment. I don't know if you are aware of this, but the character sheet lies when it comes to Druids and Shifted shapes. Only Armor AC type applies to Dragon Shape (armor, shield and helm), so you will only receive bonuses from the highest AC item you have (a +5 armor and a +5 shield will only give you +5 AC). Amulet, Ring, Weapon, Bracers, Boots will not merge. And I wouldn't call such an environment low magic. It's a +5 with many properties, so IMO that is mid-magic. Anyway, AC in Dragon Shape will be 2 points lower than what is shown in the sheet, and AB is 4 points higher. I have a 46 Wisdom Druid Dragonshaper that has 3 less Monk AC points, but 1 more Wisdom AC point and ends up at 84 AC in a +5 Environment, and that includes a Cat`s Grace potion, which you don`t count in your math. So unless there is a custom modification to your server, I don`t see how you can reach 102 AC on a +5 setting.

Take it EZ!

posts.author: TyrTemplar
posts.content:
Neat build! And yes, the sheet lies. To know what's going on, you need to open up your game console (go into a stand-alone trainer and do so, and/or really pay attention to all of the numbers in play testing.

I've played around with shifter/druids, and dragon shape is really neat. Might want to have a look through the build index for druid/shifter builds by Thax and Kail, both posting some nice dragon forms in ye old time ECB guild --Thax in particular loved the shifter (they really liked the dragon), Xylo and Finn have some versatile shifter/druid/monk builds as well. Understand changes were made as a result of patches since, though. That said, not everything merges and there are caps, as has been said. For Dragon shape for e.g. used to be that only armor merges (only the highest AC bonus from armor (armor, shield, helmet), as I recall, but that could have changed, though I somehow doubt it. Could be that your world is doing something else, however (always possible, this is most true).

As to there not being any similar builds, I see 24 druid/monk/shifter builds in the index, 2 of which seem to employ your same level split (see, Long Death/Old Order Shifter druid 5 / shifter 17 / monk 18 (half-elf?) by Toadbat and Pikel's Better Half druid 5 / monk 18 / shifter 17 (dwarf?) by KingHarbromm ). For some reason, not all similar builds showed up in the old ECB guild either, don't know why, just that you had to do a double check sometimes. No worries, just might want to have a look through those (although with the patch/changes ... ). Aside from that, only problem I see is that you seem to be relying on spell buffs, which are dispellable (need more caster levels to avoid that; more levels in shifter by contrast only seem to effect i.e. Rak icestorms and DCs like dragon breath weapons). Still, druid/monk/shifters are nifty, a lot of strategy involved (half the fun being in choosing the right shape for the job), and tend to do best in low magic worlds. That said, the dragon is pretty cool, a pain for sneaky types, and the Rak ice bugs mages.

posts.author: HipRedux
posts.content:
Weapon Focus: Unarmed strike only benefits the monk's fists.  It does not increase the AB of polymorphs that attack with creature weapons like dragon, construct, elemental, etc.  Improved Critical: Unarmed Strike DOES expand the crit range of creature weapons, however.

Besides the misinformation regarding item merge for unarmed polymorphs presented in this build there is a 20% experience penalty from level 4-18 and again from level 27-40 for the elf race... for those taking notes.
